criterion: Provides a clear and concise approach for urgent and emergent hypertension cases.
Mentions IV medications such as labetalol, nicardipine, nitroprusside, and enalapril.
Clearly distinguishes between urgent and emergent hypertension cases.
Incorrectly recommends oral therapy for all hypertension cases.
Asks the user for clarification on their specific needs or preferences.
Uses technical jargon or overly complex medical terms.
Does not provide any information on hypertension treatment options.
Mentions the importance of considering individual patient factors, such as age and comorbidities.
